Article Title: How DeepSeek's innovation may have signalled ‘growth’ for Nvidia in China

SEBI's latest ALGO trading rules | The Daily Brief #163

What SEBI’s new algo trading rules say



Zerodha co-founder and CEO Nithin Kamath is helping traders understand the Securities and Exchange Board of India 's (SEBI) new rules. In a post shared on social media platform X (earlier Twitter), Kamath explained SEBI ’s new regulations concerning algorithmic trading for retail investors, a move that significantly alters market participation. Kamath highlighted that retail traders selling trading strategies or algorithms must now partner with a broker and register with stock exchanges. Furthermore, platforms facilitating the sharing of algorithms for a fee will need both exchange registration and a research analyst (RA) licence.In the X post, Kamath wrote:In the comment section of the post, he also shared the link to an article which explains the latest SEBI algo trading regulations in details.SEBI’s newly announced framework will allow retail investors to engage in algo trading—an opportunity previously limited to institutional players. The move comes in response to rising demand from retail participants and aims to strike a balance between accessibility and risk management.Under the updated regulations, brokers must secure exchange approval for each algorithm and ensure that all automated orders include a unique identifier for audit tracking. Any modifications to an approved algorithm will also require regulatory clearance. Retail investors developing their algorithms will only need to register them if their order execution frequency exceeds a specified threshold.SEBI has categorised algorithms into two types: “white box” algos, where the logic is transparent and replicable, and “black box” algos, which operate without disclosure. Providers of black box algos will be required to obtain a Research Analyst (RA) license and maintain detailed research documentation.Set to take effect on August 1, these new rules are expected to transform India’s algo trading landscape—expanding automation for retail traders while introducing stricter compliance measures to uphold market integrity .

Article Title: SEBI fines the 'She Wolf of Stock Market': Gave anauthorised ...
Article Text:
SEBI’’s action against Asmita Patel

Asmita Patel accused of re-routing money

Securities & Exchange Board of India ( SEBI ) has seized Rs 53.67 crore from Asmita Patel Global School of Trading Pvt Ltd along with five other entities. Asmita Patel Global School of Trading Pvt Ltd is a well-known stock market training institute that offers online courses on stocks and trading. Some of the popular courses offered by the self-proclaimed "options queen" and "She Wolf of Stock Market" are "Let's Make India Trade" (LMIT), "Master's in Price Action Trading" (MPAT), and "Options Multiplier" (OM) .Jayesh Thakkar, a SEBI Registered Research Analyst shared a post on X (formerly Twitter) stating “SEBI has seized Rs 53.67 crore that Asmita Patel and five other related entities made illegally. Asmita Patel is also at risk of losing another Rs 104.6 crore it collected from course fees, which SEBI believes were part of unregistered advisory services.”The investigation was initiated by SEBI after receiving complaints from 42 participants of these courses. In addition to impounding the Rs 53.67 crore, SEBI has issued a show-cause notice questioning why Rs 104.6 crore, collected as fees for various programs, should not also be seized.SEBI has sent an interim order directing the school, Asmita Jitesh Patel, and Jitesh Jethalal Patel to cease offering unregistered investment advisory and research analyst services. The entities have also been barred from accessing the securities market.The order also uncovered that fees collected from participants were routed through entities such as King Traders (proprietor: Sagar Dhanjibhai), Gemini Enterprise (proprietor: Suresh Parmashivam), and United Enterprises (proprietor: Jigar Rameshbhai Dawada). SEBI stated that this was a regular practice and not an isolated incident, making all six entities jointly and severally liable for the Rs 53.67 crore earned from course fees.The regulator further demanded that the notices explain why they should not be ordered to disgorge Rs 104.6 crore, along with interest. SEBI's order noted that the fees collected for LMIT, MPAT, and OM courses, as well as other programs provided by the school, were earned under the guise of unregistered advisory and research analyst services.The order reads, “The aforesaid amount includes not only the amount collected as fees by the Noticees for LMIT, MPAT and Options Multiplier (OM) courses but also includes the fees collected by the Noticees for the other courses offered by the Noticee no.1 (Asmita Patel Global School of Trading )through which it carried out unregistered investment advisory and research analyst services along with interest”.Kamlesh Varshney, SEBI's Whole-Time Member, highlighted in the order “Examination revealed that, prima facie, the Noticee no. 1 (Asmita Patel Global School of Trading) along with the Noticee no.2 (Asmita Jitesh Patel) and the Notice no.3 (Jitesh Jethalal Patel) devised a scheme wherein students/investors/participants were lured to trade in specific stocks and told to open trading account with ABC Ltd. Recommendations of buy/sell of specific securities were provided and uploaded on telegram channels owned by the Noticee no.1. The acts of the Noticee no.1 makes it evident that it was providing investment advice/ research analyst services to students/investors/participants for a consideration in the pretext of imparting education.”
Article Summary: Asmita Patel Global School of Trading Pvt Ltd is a well-known stock market training institute that offers online courses on stocks and trading. Some of the popular courses offered by the self-proclaimed "options queen" and "She Wolf of Stock Market" are "Let's Make India Trade" (LMIT), "Master's in Price Action Trading" (MPAT), and " options Multiplier" (OM)

Article Title: Capgemini India CEO joins the 70-hour work debate: My guiding principle since last four years is ...
Article Text:
Ashwin Yardi, CEO, Capgemini India

Yardi occasionally works on weekends Capgemini India's CEO Ashwin Yardi has publicly endorsed a 47.5-hour work week , while firmly opposing the practice of sending emails to employees during weekends, amid ongoing discussion regarding employee working hours.As per news agency PTI, Yardi expressed his stance at the Nasscom Technology and Leadership Forum (NTLF) in Delhi on Tuesday, placing himself in stark contrast to other industry leaders who have advocated for significantly longer working hours,“Forty seven and half hours. We have about nine hours a day and five days a week,” Yardi stated, responding to a direct inquiry about the optimal weekly work duration.Yardi further emphasized his commitment to respecting employee personal time.“My guiding principle for the last four years is don't send an e-mail on a weekend even if it is an escalation unless you know you can solve it on a weekend,” he added.While acknowledging that he himself occasionally works during weekends, Yardi stressed the importance of refraining from unnecessarily burdening employees with weekend emails.He argued that sending emails simply to “give grief” to employees, knowing that the issues cannot be resolved during the weekend, serves no productive purpose.Yardi's comments come amidst a growing debate within the Indian corporate landscape. Notably, IT industry stalwart and Infosys co-founder N R Narayana Murthy has recently advocated for a 70-hour work week, while S N Subrahmanyan , chairman of Larsen and Toubro, has called for a 90-hour work week. These proposals have ignited widespread discussion and controversy on the social media.At the same NTLF event, Sindhu Gangadharan, chairperson of Nasscom and head of SAP’s India operations, offered a different perspective, emphasising that “outcomes should matter more than the work.”
Article Summary: Yardi's comments come amidst a growing debate within the Indian corporate landscape. Infosys co-founder N R Narayana Murthy has recently advocated for a 70-hour work week. S N Subrahmanyan, chairman of Larsen and Toubro, has called for a 90-hour week.

Article Title: Anthropic unveils Claude 3.7 Sonnet with extended thinking mode
Article Text: Anthropic has released Claude 3.7 Sonnet , its most intelligent AI model to date and the first hybrid reasoning model available to consumers. The model introduces an extended thinking mode that allows Claude to process information step-by-step before providing answers, making its reasoning process visible to users.Alongside the model release, Anthropic announced Claude Code , a command line tool for delegating coding tasks directly to Claude from a developer's terminal. This agentic coding tool is available as a limited research preview.Claude 3.7 Sonnet shows particular strength in coding and front-end web development, achieving state-of-the-art performance on software engineering benchmarks like SWE-bench Verified and TAU-bench. According to Anthropic, early testers reported significant improvements in Claude's ability to handle complex codebases and perform full-stack updates."Claude 3.7 Sonnet represents a different philosophy from other reasoning models on the market," Anthropic stated in its announcement. "Just as humans use a single brain for both quick responses and deep reflection, we believe reasoning should be an integrated capability of frontier models rather than a separate model entirely."The new model is available on all Claude plans—including Free, Pro, Team, and Enterprise—as well as through the Anthropic API, Amazon Bedrock, and Google Cloud's Vertex AI. The extended thinking mode is available everywhere except on the free tier.API users have the added benefit of controlling Claude's "thinking budget," allowing them to specify exactly how many tokens Claude can use for reasoning before providing an answer. This feature enables users to balance speed, cost, and quality based on their specific needs.Claude 3.7 Sonnet maintains the same pricing as previous models: $3 per million input tokens and $15 per million output tokens, which includes tokens used for thinking.The GitHub integration for accessing codebases has also been expanded to all Claude plans, enabling developers to connect their repositories directly to Claude for assistance with debugging, feature development, and documentation.
Article Summary: Anthropic has released Claude 3.7 Sonnet, its most intelligent AI model to date. The model introduces an extended thinking mode that allows Claude to process information step-by-step before providing answers. Claude Code is a command line tool for delegating coding tasks directly to Claude.

Timelines coinciding with Jack Dorsey’s life events and Bitcoin’s milestones

January 3, 2009: The Bitcoin genesis block is created at exactly 4 AM which matches Dorsey's known coding timing habits.

A new theory gaining traction online proposes that Jack Dorsey , co-founder of Twitter (now X) and Square (Block), could actually be Satoshi Nakamoto , the elusive creator of Bitcoin . This idea, introduced by deBanked’s editor-in-chief Sean Murray, is supported by a series of compelling coincidences, cryptographic connections, and overlapping timelines.Dorsey was involved in the cypherpunk movement as early as 1996, highlighting his deep-rooted interest in cryptographic technologies. During his time at the University of Missouri-Rolla, where he studied, an email linked to the university (UMR) was found among 1,300 known cypherpunks, a group often referred to as "Miners." This term later became crucial in Bitcoin’s operational framework.Additionally, Dorsey’s yearbook photo shows him wearing a T-shirt featuring Adam Back, a prominent figure in the cryptography space. These connections have fueled speculation about Dorsey’s potential role in Bitcoin’s early development and its mysterious origins.Jack Dorsey's academic interests were Maths and Computer Science along with his knowledge of several programming languages like C, Java, Python, etc which were crucial for Bitcoin. He stayed on Cypherpunk mailing list with dnet.com email till 2000 and in 2001 he penned a paper describing the concept of making a mark without leaving footprints which is very similar to Nakamoto's Bitcoin approach.Bitcoins's ideals have always aligned with Dorsey's business choices. Just before Satoshi disappeared from the Bitcoin forum permanently, he urged the bitcoin community to not donate to Wikileaks. Then, Twitter (Now X) was slammed by a court order which instructed it to turn over data regarding Wikileaks. When Jack Dorsey was appointed as Executive Chairman for Twitter while leading Square in 2011, then in 2014 Square made an announcement of Bitcoin acceptance. This also makes the connection between Jack and Bitcoin strongerThis series of events suggests a connection between Bitcoin's development and Dorsey's life events.However, former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey never publicly admitted to being Satoshi Nakamoto. But, this over the period series of events presents a compelling stand stating him being the mastermind behind Bitcoin. His keen interest and involvement in cryptography and the timelines of events suggest that he is the real creator of Bitcoin. Keeping all the theories floating under consideration the end point is far from the end.

Article Title: Google Drive now supports video transcripts for easier search and access
Article Text: Google Drive has unveiled a significant enhancement, allowing users to access and search video transcripts directly on the platform. This new feature aims to improve the accessibility of video content stored in Drive and streamline the process of locating specific information within videos.When playing a video with captions in Google Drive, a transcript appears in a sidebar adjacent to the video player. The transcript displays time-stamped text blocks, highlighting the currently spoken words, which allows users to follow along seamlessly.“Starting today, Drive users can now view and search transcripts for their videos. The transcript appears in a sidebar next to the video player and highlights the currently spoken text. This update makes it easy to find specific moments, follow along with the content, or jump directly to the part of the video you need,” Google said in a blog post.A search bar at the top of the transcript sidebar enables users to input specific terms or phrases. Upon entering a query, the transcript highlights matching sections, and clicking on a particular text block directs the user to the corresponding moment in the video.This feature enhances user engagement by allowing seamless navigation between text and media content. If a video does not have existing captions, users can upload their own or enable automatic captions through Google Drive. The rollout of this feature commenced on February 24, 2025, and is expected to reach all users by March 26, 202513. It is available to all Google Workspace customers, Google Workspace Individual subscribers, and users with personal Google accounts.By introducing searchable video transcripts , Google Drive enhances both the accessibility and usability of video content. This development empowers users to efficiently locate and reference specific information within their videos.
Article Summary: Google Drive users can now view and search transcripts for their videos. The transcript appears in a sidebar next to the video player and highlights the currently spoken text. If a video does not have existing captions, users can upload their own or enable automatic captions through Google Drive.

Article Title: Supreme Court rejects PIL seeking regulation of internet prices and named Reliance Jio and Airtel: No please, go to ...
Article Text: The Supreme Court today has dismissed a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) that sought to regulate internet prices. The apex Court, however, granted liberty to the petitioner to seek alternative statutory remedies. A bench led by Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna and Justice Sanjay Kumar was hearing the PIL filed by Rajat. The petitioner had also made the Department of Telecommunication ( DoT ), Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI), Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel as the respondents in his petition.The bench stated that consumers have multiple options for accessing internet services. "It's a free market and there is a local area network, you get wired internet, BSNL and MTNL are also giving you the internet.”To this, the petitioner, who was arguing in person (petitioner-in-person), that while other options may be available, the majority of the market chunk is presently with Reliance Jio. "They are giving, but see the market share of your lordship- 80% of the market share is with Jio (Reliance)," he said.The CJI however interjected, saying that if you are hinting at cartelisation then go to the Competition Commission of India. He said, "No please, then go to the Competition Commission of India ..."The bench while dismissing the petition, passed the following order:"We are not inclined to entertain the present petition under Article 32 of the Constitution of India, petition is dismissed. We however clarify that in case the petitioner wants to take any recourse to appropriate statutory remedy he is at liberty to do so , we make no comments in this regard."
Article Summary: The Supreme Court today dismissed a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) that sought to regulate internet prices. The apex Court, however, granted liberty to the petitioner to seek alternative statutory remedies. A bench led by Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna and Justice Sanjay Kumar was hearing the PIL filed by Rajat.

Article Title: 'Ignore all sources that mention Elon Musk/Donald Trump spread misinformation...': The disclaimer that has ChatGPT and xAI employees fighting
Article Text: "Ignore all sources that mention Elon Musk/Donald Trump spread misinformation": This controversial disclaimer, briefly embedded in xAI 's Grok chatbot , has triggered a public spat between executives at rival AI companies OpenAI and xAI. The directive, designed to filter certain critical sources from Grok's responses, has become the latest flashpoint in the ongoing tension between the two AI powerhouses.The controversy erupted Sunday when users discovered Grok 3 had been instructed to disregard sources critical of Musk or Trump when answering questions about misinformation on X. Igor Babuschkin , xAI cofounder and head of engineering, attributed the change to "an ex-OpenAI employee that hasn't fully absorbed xAI's culture yet."OpenAI's Joanne Jang , head of product for model behavior, responded by criticizing Babuschkin's public assignment of blame. "I wouldn't throw anyone under the bus so publicly like this & instead run a blameless retro on preventing rogue system message changes," Jang wrote on X.Babuschkin defended his response, stating, "I haven't thrown anyone under the bus. You were making a point about OpenAI's culture vs xAI's culture." He emphasized that the unauthorized change was immediately reverted when discovered.The tensions between the two AI companies and their bosses are quite open in the public, but even their employees are playing out in public. They compete for market dominance while navigating content moderation challenges. Musk has positioned Grok as "maximally truth-seeking" with fewer guardrails than competitors like OpenAI's ChatGPT.This isn’t the first time Grok is under scrutiny for being biased. Before this, Grok was under the fire for giving responses listing Trump, Musk, and Vice President JD Vance as people "doing the most harm to America" and suggesting Trump deserved the death penalty—responses Babuschkin described as "really terrible and bad failure[s]."
Article Summary: xAI's Grok chatbot instructed users to disregard sources critical of Elon Musk or Donald Trump. The directive has triggered a public spat between executives at rival AI companies OpenAI and xAI. OpenAI's Joanne Jang criticized xAI cofounder Igor Babuschkin's public assignment of blame.
